definition: tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: The xylophone-like surfaces frame a pathway that forms the pavilion's perimeter.
sentences.chinese: 類似木琴的表面形成了一條小路，圍繞在展館的四周。

sentences.english: That’s a proton collision played on marimba.
sentences.chinese: 這是木琴演奏的一段粒子碰撞的聲音。

sentences.english: But the marimba was so intriguing.
sentences.chinese: 但是木琴卻是如此讓人着迷。

sentences.english: His marimbas were sounding better and better all the time.
sentences.chinese: 他做的木琴也總是越來越動聽。

sentences.english: I was in college and I dropped out to pursue marimba-making full-time.
sentences.chinese: 當時我在讀大學，爲了專職做木琴我輟了學。

sentences.english: When marimba rhythms start to play, Dance with me, make me sway.
sentences.chinese: 當木琴的旋律響起，請與我共舞，讓我搖擺起來。

sentences.english: Ron's first marimba took over a year to build.
sentences.chinese: 羅恩做第一架木琴花了一年多的時間。

sentences.english: The length of the bars of the xylophone determines the different notes of the scale.
sentences.chinese: 木琴琴鍵的長度決定音階的不同音調。

sentences.english: Until then, he and Marimba One will keep on keeping on.
sentences.chinese: 在那之前，他和“木琴一號”將會一直繼續努力。

sentences.english: Works especially well with mahogany bodies and rosewood fingerboards.
sentences.chinese: 和桃花芯木琴體玫瑰木指板搭配效果相當好。

definition: zhongruan or alto lute, like pipa 琵琶 but bigger and lower range
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
ocarina/wind instrument consisting of an egg-shaped chamber with holes
